member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIConsts
member.summary: Summary description for FastInfosetConsts.

member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncoding
member.summary: Abstract base class of Fast Infoset encodings and .

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncoding.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of FIEncoding.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncoding.Encode(System.Object)
member.summary: Method used to encode the data in the derived concrete class.
member.param: Data to encode
member.remarks: The data to encode should be of a type expected by the specific derived concrete class.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncoding.Decode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Method used to decode the data in the derived concrete class.
member.param: Data to decode
member.remarks: The decoded data must always return as a string value as this will be read by the FIReader as if it were over a standard XML text document. The string returned may be string representation of binary data, e.g. Hex or Base64 encoded. The client would be expected to decode to binary data as required in the same way they would if they were reading an plain XML text document.

member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncodingAlgorithm
member.summary: Base class for implementing custom Encoding Algorithms [X.891 Section 8.3].

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncodingAlgorithm.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creats an instance of FIEncodingAlgorithm using the specified URI.
member.param: URI used as the unique identifier for this encoding.

remarks.para: Each entry in this table specifies the encoding of a character string with some defined characteristics into an octet string [X.891 Section 7.17.7].

NOTE – The defined characteristics may refer to the length of the string, to the characters appearing in it, or to an arbitrarily complex pattern of characters. In general, a given encoding algorithm applies only to a special and defined subset of the ISO/IEC 10646 character strings.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIEncodingAlgorithm.URI
member.summary: Uniquely identifies this Encoding Algorithm

member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIParser
member.summary: Summary description for FastInfosetReader.

member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to XML binary encoded data that conforms to the ITU-T: Fast infoset X.891 (05/2005) recommendation.
member.remarks: The FIReader class derives from the System.Xml.XmlReader .Net Framework class and supports the abstract methods required to integrate with other .Net Framework XML classes such as System.Xml.XmlDocument.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XmlTextReader class with the specified file.
member.param: The URL for the file containing the XML data.
member.exception: url is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)
url is an empty string.
url is not a valid URI.
There is a runtime error (for example, an interrupted server connection).

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.#ctor(System.String,LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIVocabularyManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XmlTextReader class with the specified file.
member.param: The URL for the file containing the XML data.
A containing a mapping of URIs to objects. If the Fast Infoset to be read references an External Vocabulary, the URI used must exist with the provided vocabulary manager.
member.exception: url is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)
url is an empty string.
url is not a valid URI.
There is a runtime error (for example, an interrupted server connection).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XmlTextReader class with the specified file.
member.param: The URL for the file containing the XML data.
A containing a mapping of URIs to objects. If the Fast Infoset to be read references an External Vocabulary, the URI used must exist with the provided vocabulary manager.
An to write strings into.
member.exception: url is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic)
url is an empty string.
url is not a valid URI.
There is a runtime error (for example, an interrupted server connection).

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.AttributeCount
member.summary: Gets the number of attributes on the current node.
member.value: The number of attributes on the current node.
member.remarks: This property is relevant to Element, DocumentType and XmlDeclaration nodes only. (Other node types do not have attributes.)

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.BaseURI
member.summary: The method or operation is not implemented.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.Close
member.summary: Changes the to Closed.
member.remarks: This method also releases any resources held while reading. If this reader was constructed using a stream, this method also calls Close on the underlying stream.If Close has already been called, no action is performed.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.Depth
member.summary: Gets the depth of the current node in the XML document.
member.value: The depth of the current node in the XML document.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.EOF
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the reader is positioned at the end of the stream.
member.value: true if the reader is positioned at the end of the stream; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.GetAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified index.
member.param: The index of the attribute. The index is zero-based. (The first attribute has index 0.)
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute.
member.remarks: This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.GetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified local name and namespace URI.
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned. This method does not move the reader.
member.remarks: This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the attribute with the specified name.
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned.
member.remarks: This method does not move the reader.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.HasValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current node can have a other than String.Empty.
member.value: true if the node on which the reader is currently positioned can have a Value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is relevant to Attribute, CDATA, Comment, ProcessingInstruction, Text and XmlDeclaration

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: The method or operation is not implemented.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.LocalName
member.summary: Gets the local name of the current node.
member.value: The name of the current node with the prefix removed. For example, LocalName is book for the element <bk:book>. For node types that do not have a name (like Text, Comment, and so on), this property returns String.Empty.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.LookupNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: The method or operation is not implemented.
member.param: The prefix whose namespace URI you want to resolve. To match the default namespace, pass an empty string.
member.returns: The namespace URI to which the prefix maps or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no matching prefix is found.
member.exception: prefix value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The method or operation is not implemented.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute with the specified local name and namespace URI.
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.
member.remarks: After calling MoveToAttribute, the , , and properties reflects the properties of that attribute.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute with the specified name.
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.
member.remarks: After calling MoveToAttribute, the , , and properties reflects the properties of that attribute.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.MoveToAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute with the specified index.
member.param: The index of the attribute.
member.remarks: After calling MoveToAttribute, the , , and properties reflects the properties of that attribute.
member.exception: The i parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to AttributeCount.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.MoveToElement
member.summary: Moves to the element that contains the current attribute node.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned on an attribute (the reader moves to the element that owns the attribute); false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute (the position of the reader does not change).
member.remarks: Use this method to return to an element after navigating through its attributes. This method moves the reader to one of the following node types: Element, DocumentType, or XmlDeclaration.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: Moves to the first attribute.
member.returns: true if an attribute exists (the reader moves to the first attribute); otherwise, false (the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves to the next attribute.
member.returns: true if there is a next attribute; false if there are no more attributes.
member.remarks: If the current node is an element node, this method is equivalent to . If MoveToNextAttribute returns true, the reader moves to the next attribute; otherwise, the position of the reader does not change.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.NameTable
member.summary: The associated with this implementation
member.exception: The method or operation is not implemented.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.NamespaceURI
member.summary: Gets the namespace URI (as defined in the W3C Namespace specification) of the node on which the reader is positioned.
member.value: The namespace URI of the current node; otherwise an empty string.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the type of the current node.
member.value: One of the values representing the type of the current node.
member.remarks: This property never returns the following XmlNodeType types: Document, DocumentFragment, Entity, EndEntity, or Notation.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.Prefix
member.summary: Gets the namespace prefix associated with the current node.
member.value: The namespace prefix associated with the current node.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next node from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next node was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.
member.exception: An error occurred while parsing the Fast Infoset.
member.remarks: When a reader is first created and initialized, there is no information available. You must call Read to read the first node.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.ReadAttributeValue
member.summary: Parses the attribute value into one or more Text, EntityReference, or EndEntity nodes.
member.returns: true if there are nodes to return. false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute node when the initial call is made or if all the attribute values have been read. An empty attribute, such as, misc="", returns true with a single node with a value of String.Empty.
member.remarks: Use this method after calling MoveToAttribute to read through the text or entity reference nodes that make up the attribute value. The Depth of the attribute value nodes is one plus the of the attribute node; it increments and decrements by one when you step into and out of general entity references.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.ReadState
member.summary: Gets the state of the reader.

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.ResolveEntity
member.summary: The method or operation is not implemented.
member.exception: The method or operation is not implemented.

member.name: P:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIReader.Value
member.summary: Gets the text value of the current node.
member.value:
The value returned depends on the of the node. The following table lists node types that have a value to return. All other node types return String.Empty.
Attribute - The value of the attribute.
CDATA - The content of the CDATA section.
Comment - The content of the comment.
DocumentType - The internal subset.
ProcessingInstruction - The entire content, excluding the target.
SignificantWhitespace - The white space within an xml:space= 'preserve' scope.
Text - The content of the text node.
Whitespace - The white space between markup.
XmlDeclaration - The content of the declaration.

member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIRestrictedAlphabet
member.summary: Implementation of Fast Infoset Restricted Alphabet [X.891 Section 8.2].

member.name: M:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIRestrictedAlphabet.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of FIRestrictedAlphabet using the specified characters.
member.param: Characters that form the Restricted Alphabet.

remarks.para: Each entry in the restricted alphabet table shall be an ordered set of distinct ISO/IEC 10646 characters of any size between 2 and 220 characters.

NOTE – A restricted alphabet permits a compact encoding of any character string consisting entirely of characters from that set, through the assignment of progressive integers to the characters in the set and the use of those integers to encode the characters of the string [X.891 Section 7.17.6].

member.name: T:LiquidTechnologies.FastInfoset.FIWriter
member.summary: Represents a writer that provides a fast, non-cached, forward-only way of generating streams or files containing XML binary encoded data that conforms to the ITU-T: Fast infoset X.891 (05/2005) recommendation.

remarks.para: The FIWriter class derives from the System.Xml.XmlWriter .Net Framework class and supports the abstract methods required to integrate with other .Net Framework XML classes such as System.Xml.XmlDocument.

note.para: In the Microsoft .NET Framework version 2.0 release, the recommended practice is to create XmlWriter instances using the System.Xml.XmlWriter.Create method and the XmlWriterSettings class. This allows you to take full advantage of all the new features introduced in this release. For more information, see Creating XML Writers.
